one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dramatically elevated expression during feline enteroepithelial stages (EES1-EES5) with peak levels in early stages (EES1: ~4,200 TPM, 99.6th percentile) compared to much lower expression in tachyzoites (~130 TPM, 84.9th percentile) and tissue cysts (~54 TPM, 74.9th percentile) in Toxoplasma gondii.
notes: The >30-fold upregulation during enteroepithelial stages suggests this gene plays a critical role in the sexual development cycle within the feline host, with expression decreasing progressively from EES1 to EES5.
experiment_name: Feline enterocyte, tachyzoite, bradyzoite stage transcriptome

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dramatically elevated expression in feline enteroepithelial stages (EES1-5) with values reaching >4000 TPM compared to very low expression (<3 TPM) in oocyst stages and moderate expression (~130 TPM) in tachyzoites, indicating strong stage-specific upregulation during the sexual cycle in Toxoplasma gondii.
notes: The >1000-fold difference between EES stages and other life cycle stages, combined with consistently high percentile rankings (>98th percentile) in EES stages, suggests this gene plays a critical role in sexual reproduction within the feline host.
experiment_name: Full life-cycle transcriptome of T. gondii

one_sentence_summary: This gene exhibits cell cycle-regulated expression in Toxoplasma gondii RH strain parasites, showing a clear oscillatory pattern with peak expression around 5-7 hours and 11-12 hours post-thymidine synchronization, indicating approximately 12-hour periodicity consistent with the parasite cell cycle.
notes: The gene shows robust oscillatory expression with ~1.4-fold change between minimum and maximum values (10.6-12.0 log2), and consistently high percentile rankings (90th-97th percentile), suggesting this is a highly expressed, cell cycle-regulated gene. The spline-smoothed data confirms the periodic pattern.
experiment_name: Cell Cycle Expression Profiles (RH)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows highest expression in T. gondii Type I strains (RMA ~10), moderate expression in Type III strains (RMA ~8.7), and notably lower expression in Type II strains (RMA ~6.6), indicating lineage-specific differential regulation.
notes: The Pru strain (Type II) shows particularly low expression compared to the ME49 strain within the same lineage, suggesting potential strain-specific variation beyond just lineage differences. High percentile rankings (90-96%) for most strains except Pru indicate this is a highly expressed gene overall.
experiment_name: Expression profiling of 3 archetypal lineages

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows highest expression in tachyzoites (2 days in vitro) and moderate expression in bradyzoites, while being consistently downregulated across all oocyst developmental stages in Toxoplasma gondii.
notes: Clear stage-specific expression pattern with ~2-fold higher expression in actively dividing tachyzoites compared to oocysts, suggesting potential role in acute infection phase rather than environmental persistence stages.
experiment_name: Oocyst, tachyzoite, and bradyzoite developmental expression profiles (M4)

one_sentence_summary: This gene is highly upregulated in merozoites compared to tachyzoites in Toxoplasma gondii, showing consistently elevated expression levels (13.24-13.5) across all three cat-derived merozoite samples versus the tachyzoite control (8.83).
notes: The fold-change is substantial (~4.5-fold increase) and consistent across all merozoite samples with high percentile rankings (>98%), suggesting this gene plays an important role in merozoite biology or stage-specific functions.
experiment_name: Merozoite Gene Expression

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strain-specific upregulation in response to alkaline pH (8.2) bradyzoite differentiation conditions, with particularly strong induction in the CTGara strain (95th percentile) and moderate induction in ME49 and GT1 strains, while showing minimal response to Compound 1 treatment across all Toxoplasma gondii strains.
notes: The CTGara strain shows the most dramatic response to pH 8.2 (>2-fold increase from baseline), suggesting potential strain-specific regulation of this gene during bradyzoite differentiation. The differential response between pH 8.2 and Compound 1 induction methods indicates this gene may be specifically responsive to alkaline stress rather than general bradyzoite differentiation signals.
experiment_name: Bradyzoite Differentiation Expression Profiles (ME49, GT1, CTGara)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression throughout the T. gondii tachyzoite infection time course, with sense transcript levels ranging from 116-241 TPM and ranking in the 88-93rd percentiles, while antisense transcripts remain negligible.
notes: The gene maintains high expression levels throughout infection with peak expression at 36 hours post-infection, suggesting an important role in tachyzoite biology during host cell infection.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (ME49)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression that decreases over time in T. gondii tachyzoites, with transcript levels dropping from 379.91 TPM at 2 hours to 166.58 TPM at 36 hours post-infection, consistently ranking in the top 5-12% of all expressed genes.
notes: Gene shows consistent downregulation over the 36-hour time course with very low antisense expression throughout; high percentile rankings indicate this is among the most highly expressed genes in the parasite transcriptome.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (RH)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression throughout the time course in T. gondii GT1 tachyzoites with peak expression at 4 hours post-infection (454.47 TPM), followed by a gradual decline to 16 hours, consistently ranking in the 91st-96th percentile of all expressed genes.
notes: Expression peaks early at 4 hours then gradually declines, suggesting potential involvement in early infection processes. Consistently high percentile rankings (>90th) indicate this is among the most highly expressed genes in the parasite transcriptome during this time period.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (GT1)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites with 116.01 TPM in the sense direction (83.68th percentile), indicating substantial upregulation in this chronic infection stage.
notes: Strong sense/antisense strand bias (116.01 vs 0.24 TPM) suggests proper directional expression; high percentile ranking indicates this gene is among the more highly expressed genes in bradyzoites
experiment_name: Bradyzoite in vitro Transcriptome (ME49)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong upregulation in merozoites compared to tachyzoites in Toxoplasma gondii, with approximately 7-fold higher expression in the merozoite stage (1815 TPM vs 244 TPM).
notes: The gene shows consistently higher expression in merozoites across both unique and total counts, with merozoite expression ranking in the 98th percentile vs 92nd percentile for tachyzoites, suggesting this gene may have important merozoite-specific functions.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite and merozoite transcriptomes

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows markedly higher expression in neurons (1003 TPM) compared to other mouse cell types during T. gondii infection, with moderate expression in astrocytes (259 TPM) and skeletal muscle cells (168 TPM), and lowest expression in fibroblasts (36 TPM).
notes: The gene consistently ranks in very high percentiles (94-98th) across all cell types, suggesting it is among the most highly expressed genes in the parasite transcriptome during infection, with particularly strong expression in neural cell types.
experiment_name: T gondii Transcriptome during infection in 4 mouse cell types

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows substantial strain-dependent expression variation across the 29 Toxoplasma gondii strains during murine macrophage infection, with notably high expression in ROD (241.52 TPM, 93rd percentile), GT1 (217.72 TPM, 92nd percentile), and WTD3 (164.56 TPM, 91st percentile) strains, while being markedly lower in PRU delta HXGPRT (16.24 TPM, 41st percentile) and RH delta HXGPRT (17.97 TPM, 53rd percentile) strains.
notes: The 15-fold expression difference between highest (ROD) and lowest (PRU delta HXGPRT) expressing strains suggests this gene may be important for strain-specific virulence or host interaction mechanisms. The HXGPRT deletion strains show notably lower expression, which may be relevant for interpretation.
experiment_name: Transcriptomes of 29 strains during murine macrophage infection

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong upregulation in Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites (162.09 TPM) and moderate upregulation in sporozoites (62.98 TPM) compared to frozen sporozoite controls (0 TPM), with tachyzoite expression remaining high even in the presence of frozen sporozoites.
notes: High percentile rankings (89-91%) indicate this gene is among the most highly expressed in the parasite transcriptome during infection, suggesting it may play an important role in active infection stages but not in dormant forms.
experiment_name: T. gondii during infection in IEC18 cells (Dual RNA-Seq)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dramatically increased expression in the GRA18 complemented strain (62-81 TPM, 75-78th percentile) compared to both wild-type and GRA18 knockout strains (7-12 TPM, 31-35th percentile), with this pattern maintained regardless of LPS treatment.
notes: The consistent 5-7 fold upregulation in the complemented strain suggests potential overexpression from the complementation construct rather than restoration to wild-type levels, which may indicate either regulatory differences or copy number effects.
experiment_name: Transcriptome of Wild-Type and gra18 mutant strains of T. gondii

one_sentence_summary: This Toxoplasma gondii gene shows highest expression in Type II parasite-infected neurons (288.33 TPM), moderate expression in Type III infected neurons (90.91 TPM), low expression in Type II bystander neurons (14.38 TPM), and no detectable expression in Type III bystander neurons.
notes: High standard errors suggest variability between replicates, particularly for Type II TINs; the gene appears to be strain-specific with preferential expression during Type II infections and shows clear infection-dependent expression patterns.
experiment_name: Parasite transcriptome during infection in mouse brain.

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows markedly higher expression in MORC knockdown strains (90-130 TPM) compared to wild-type Toxoplasma gondii (13-40 TPM), indicating strong upregulation when MORC function is disrupted.
notes: The ~7-10 fold higher expression in MORC KD conditions suggests this gene is normally repressed by MORC-mediated chromatin silencing. Some variability observed with IAA treatment duration in the knockdown strains.
experiment_name: RNA-Seq of MORC WT and MORC KD parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate upregulation during T. gondii bradyzoite differentiation, with expression levels gradually increasing from early timepoints (5.28-6.81 log2) to peak at late stages (8.5-9.77 log2 at 8-14 days post-infection).
notes: The data contains multiple experimental series with some duplicate timepoints showing variable expression levels, suggesting biological variability or different experimental conditions; the most dramatic upregulation occurs in the extended time series (14 days reaching 94th percentile).
experiment_name: Bradyzoite Differentiation (Multiple 6-hr time points and Extended time series)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all conditions with modest upregulation during bradyzoite differentiation in wild-type Toxoplasma gondii, while most insertional mutants fail to achieve the same level of bradyzoite-associated expression increase.
notes: Gene shows high baseline expression (94-98th percentiles) across all conditions, suggesting constitutive importance. The wild-type shows clear tachyzoite-to-bradyzoite upregulation (12.1 to 13.02), but most mutants show blunted or absent upregulation during differentiation, indicating this gene may be involved in normal bradyzoite differentiation pathways.
experiment_name: Mutants and wild-type expression profiles during bradyzoite differentiation

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows higher expression in the GCN5-A knockout strain compared to wild type under both unstressed and stressed conditions, with minimal response to alkaline stress in either strain.
notes: The gene shows constitutively higher expression in the knockout strain (values ~12.1-12.3) compared to wild type (~11.0-11.5), suggesting it may be negatively regulated by GCN5-A. The small standard errors indicate reliable measurements.
experiment_name: Differential Expression Profiling GCN5-A mutant

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate upregulation in both PRMT1 knockout and complement strains compared to wild-type Toxoplasma gondii, with expression levels increasing from 9.31 to 10.24 and 10.42 respectively.
notes: The upregulation persists even in the complemented strain, suggesting either incomplete complementation or that PRMT1 deletion triggers compensatory mechanisms that are not fully reversed by complementation.
experiment_name: PMRT1 KO, WT and KOCM expression profiles

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression (87-88th percentile) on the sense strand throughout the T. gondii tachyzoite infection time course from 2-44 hours post-infection, with peak expression at 16 hours, while antisense expression remains negligible.
notes: The gene maintains consistently high expression levels (108-149 TPM) with relatively stable temporal dynamics, suggesting a housekeeping or constitutively important function during tachyzoite infection rather than stage-specific regulation.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (VEG)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate to high expression (69.38 TPM, 80.57th percentile) in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites with no detectable antisense transcription, indicating standard sense-strand transcription during the chronic infection stage.
notes: Single-condition experiment with no comparative samples limits assessment of differential expression; importance based on moderate-high expression level and percentile ranking in bradyzoite stage
experiment_name: Bradyzoite in vivo transcriptome (M4)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate expression in Toxoplasma gondii oocysts with a notable 10-fold increase in sense strand expression by day 10 post-sporulation, while antisense expression peaks transiently at day 4.
notes: The dramatic increase in sense strand expression at day 10 (7.1 TPM vs 0.69-0.88 TPM at earlier timepoints) suggests potential developmental regulation during oocyst maturation, though the relatively low absolute expression levels and lack of replicates limit interpretation.
experiment_name: Oocyst Time Series (M4)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows higher expression during acute infection (10 days post-infection) compared to chronic infection (28 days post-infection) in Toxoplasma gondii, with approximately 2.3-fold greater transcript abundance in the acute phase.
notes: The gene shows moderately high percentile rankings in both conditions (87th percentile acute, 64th percentile chronic), suggesting it is generally well-expressed but with clear temporal regulation during infection progression.
experiment_name: Transcriptome during acute or chronic infection in mouse brain

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dose-dependent upregulation in response to tartrolon E treatment in Toxoplasma gondii, with expression increasing over time and reaching highest levels (16.31 TPM) at 12 hours with 24.2 nM treatment compared to control levels of 7.93-8.69 TPM.
notes: The gene shows clear dose-dependent and time-dependent upregulation with tartrolon E treatment, with minimal antisense expression indicating genuine transcriptional response. The ~2-fold maximum increase is moderate but consistent across the time course.
experiment_name: RNA-seq of tartrolon E-treated T. gondii RH parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows progressive upregulation in Toxoplasma gondii following CPSF4 knockdown, with expression increasing approximately 2-fold by 48 hours post-auxin treatment (46 TPM untreated to 89-92 TPM at 48h).
notes: The antisense expression remains very low throughout, confirming strand-specific upregulation. The progressive increase over time suggests this gene may be regulated by CPSF4-mediated RNA processing mechanisms.
experiment_name: RNA-Seq of CPSF4 WT and CPSF4 KD parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression throughout Toxoplasma gondii differentiation in rat brain cells (156-238 TPM across all time points), with the highest expression at 14 days post-infection, while maintaining much lower expression in tachyzoites (29 TPM).
notes: Gene shows upregulation during differentiation process compared to tachyzoites, with particularly high expression in later time points suggesting potential role in bradyzoite maintenance or chronic infection establishment.
experiment_name: T. gondii during spontaneous differentiation in primary rat brain cells.

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows modest upregulation during Toxoplasma gondii differentiation from tachyzoites to bradyzoites, with expression increasing from day 0 to day 2 and then gradually declining through day 4.
notes: The expression change is relatively modest (0.8 log2 fold increase at peak) and the percentile values suggest intermediate expression levels throughout the time course, indicating this gene may play a supporting rather than central role in differentiation.
experiment_name: Bradyzoite Differentiation (3-day time series)(Pru)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites across all time points (28, 90, and 120 days post-infection), with TPM values remaining stable around 76-83 and ranking in the 74-76th percentile compared to all genes.
notes: Expression levels are stable across the time course with minimal variation, suggesting constitutive expression rather than temporal regulation during chronic infection.
experiment_name: Mouse brain bradyzoite transcriptomes at 28, 90, 120 days post infection

one_sentence_summary: This gene maintains stable, high expression levels in T. gondii tachyzoites between day 3 and day 4 post-infection, with TPM values remaining consistently around 185-200 and ranking in the 91st-92nd percentile relative to all genes.
notes: The gene shows consistently high expression (>90th percentile) but minimal temporal variation, suggesting constitutive importance rather than dynamic regulation during this infection period.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome 3 and 4 days post-infection (VEG NcLIV)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression in both tachyzoite and bradyzoite stages of Toxoplasma gondii, with a modest but consistent upregulation in bradyzoites compared to tachyzoites (240.73 vs 213.6 TPM).
notes: Both unique and total read counts show the same directional pattern. High percentile rankings (>91%) indicate this is among the most highly expressed genes in both conditions, suggesting constitutive importance across life stages.
experiment_name: Stage-specific RNA-sequencing in Toxoplasma gondii

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows modest downregulation in Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites during invasion, with expression decreasing from extracellular parasites (9.71) to intracellular parasites at 0 hours (9.36) and further to 2 hours post-invasion (9.2).
notes: The expression change is relatively small (0.51 log2 units total) but shows a consistent downward trend during invasion. High percentile values (91-93%) indicate this is a highly expressed gene overall.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite transcriptome during invasion (RH)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate expression with slightly higher transcript levels in intracellular compared to extracellular Toxoplasma gondii parasites, with consistent detection in both RNA-seq and ribosome profiling data indicating active translation.
notes: The gene shows consistent sense-strand expression across conditions with minimal antisense transcription. High percentile rankings (82-95th percentile) suggest this gene is among the more highly expressed genes in the genome, though the modest fold-change between conditions limits biological significance.
experiment_name: Comparative ribosome profiling of intracellular and extracellular parasites
